title.narrative: SAFE LEARNING ENVIRONMENTS

description.narrative: SEDUC, municipalities and communities have the capacity to provide safe learning spaces (guarantee physical and psychological security) and the educational inclusion of girls and boys, mainly those in conditions of greater disadvantage., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 2. By 2021, children and adolescents at greater disadvantage, mainly those affected by violence, forced displacement and migration, have access to safe, inclusive, flexible and innovative forms of quality education.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: SEDUC, municipalities and communities have the capacity to provide safe learning spaces (guarantee physical and psychologicalsecurity) and the educational inclusion of girls and boys, mainly those in conditions of greater disadvantage.

description.narrative: A total of 1,800 members of the education community, including teachers, parents, and students in 120 schools in 19 municipalities of nine departments developed the capacity to provide safe learning spaces, reaching 28,499 enrolled students, strengthening resilience to the adverse effects of climate change with a focus on COVID-19 prevention; providing safe access to WASH services, including a gender focus through menstrual hygiene management; improving emergency preparedness for disaster risk reduction and enabling them to replicate and disseminate key knowledge, attitudes, and practices in their communities. | Status:Met | As-of Date:27/01/2022
